newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-ANGELS LHP LANGSTON UNDERGOES ELBOW SURGERY.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-ANGELS LHP LANGSTON UNDERGOES ELBOW SURGERY.

text.p: Anaheim Angels left-hander Mark Langston underwent arthroscopic surgery to remove inflamed and damaged tissue from his injured left elbow on Tuesday, the team announced.
The 36-year-old Langston was placed on the 15-day disabled list May 23 after missing two starts. No timetable has been set for his return.
The four-time All-Star, who had arthroscopic surgery in 1994 to remove bone chips from his left elbow, is 2-3 this season with a 5.01 ERA in eight starts.
Left-hander Matt Perisho was recalled from Double-A Midland to take Langston's place on the roster.
